title: Comartin 2016 Adelaide's Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Candied strawberry fruit and a touch of lemon peel make for a fairly mellow nose on this bottling, named after winemaker Adam Comartin's daughter. There is a sizzle of acidity, a grippy texture and clean lines of sour cherry flavor on the palate, which holds its tension deep into the finish.

title: Castillo's Hillside Shire 2013 Petit Verdot (Santa Clara County)
description: Blackberries, asphalt, char and black pepper show on the nose of this bottling from a winery in Morgan Hill. It's a little thin on the palate, especially for what can be a thick and dense grape, but the flavors are solid, with dark plum, coffee and pepper.

title: Château de Pizay 2016 Château de Saint Lager  (Brouilly)
description: This wine has a firm structure as well as plenty of fruit. The wine's acidity, crisp red-currant fruit and bright character are balanced by the firm, smoky and dry tannins. Give this structure time to soften and fill out into a ripe wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Château de Pizay 2016  Morgon
description: For this appellation, this is a soft wine, full of bright cherry flavors and attractive acidity. A jammy character brings out rich fruitiness that will allow the wine to be ready from 2018.

title: Bersano 2015 Cremosina  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)
description: This opens with spiced blueberry, red plum and tilled earth aromas while the medium-bodied palate doles out blackberry, black cherry and clove flavors. Fine-grained tannins and firm acidity provide support. Drink through 2020.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2014 Glorioso Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of creamy vanilla and mixed berry fruits are a bit jumbled. This has a full, grabby, chunky palate, with spicy plum and peppery flavors that don't show a lot of variation or complexity. On the finish, there's heat and oak to cut through.

title: Bodegas Vegalfaro 2016 Caprasia Red (Utiel-Requena)
description: Malty, earthy, roasted berry aromas become more chocolaty as this wine breathes. An oaky, resiny palate is saturated and shows spicy, peppery black-fruit flavors along with some heat. This Bobal-Merlot blend sizzles on a full-throttle finish that's not shy on oak.

title: Stephen Ross 2016 Spanish Springs Vineyard Pinot Gris (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Broad aromas of Asian pear, kaffir lime and wet stone show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard located just minutes from the sands of Pismo Beach. There is a great sizzle of acidity on the sip, with candied apple flavors, slightly sour lime and grapefruit peels. There's also the slightest touch of sweetness.

title: Sylvaine et Alain Normand 2015 Les Crays  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: This is a smooth, rich wine, full of tropical mango and pineapple flavors, with the lightest touch of acidity. Drink this superrich wine now.

title: Rabble 2015 Mossfire Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh boysenberry aromas are lifted by dried dill, black pepper and black olive on the spice-driven nose of this bottling. Tangy plum and underrripe berry flavors pop on the tense palate, where anise, oregano and marjoram round out the experience.

title: Red Newt Cellars 2016 Circle Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: There's a honeyed tone to this medium-sweet Riesling that is light on its feet with spine-tingling acidity. Earthier elements of crushed stone and saffron lend subtle nuance to juicy grapefruit, lime and green apple. Easy going and fresh, it should be enjoyed young through 2019.

title: Januik 2015 Bacchus Vineyard Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine's citrus zest and honeysuckle aromas seem a bit light for the variety. It drinks off dry, with fleshy stone fruit flavors.

title: Kestrel 2013 Signature Series Old Vine Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)
description: Brooding aromas of barrel spice, graphite, plum, herb, anise, char and blackberry are followed by dark fruit flavors in this wine, which shows appealing restraint.

title: Kitá 2014 Spe'y Camp 4 Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There's an intriguing touch of peanut brittle as well as underripe berries, rose petals and roasted game on the nose of this blend of 55% Grenache, 25% Syrah and 20% Carignane. The palate offers dried cranberry and tar flavors.

title: L'Ecole No. 41 2014 Estate Grown Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This combines fruit from Ferguson (60%) and Seven Hills vineyards to deliver barrel spice, clove, raspberry and mineral scents. The palate is medium bodied and full of chewy, slightly dry tannins. The oak shows prominently at present, needing more time in bottle to integrate.

title: Leyda 2014 Lot 8 Syrah (Leyda Valley)
description: This highly demanding coastal Syrah is intense from start to tail. Aromas of wet cement, eucalyptus and saucy, herbal tomato and plum are anything but easy. It feels extracted and tough. Saucy flavors of herbal black plum and tomato are on the green spectrum, finishing spunky and toasty. Drink through 2022.

title: Loica 2014 Andes Series Malbec (Colchagua Valley)
description: Slightly foxy red-berry and plum aromas are spicy and a touch earthy. A wide, blocky palate is trying hard to stay in line, but this Malbec weighs in on the heavy side. Flavors of toasty, minty blackberry finish with chocolate and spice notes.

title: Marchesi di Barolo 2016  Barbera d'Alba
description: This leads with violet, black-skinned berry and baking spice aromas while red cherry, raspberry and white pepper flavors mark the savory palate. Smooth tannins and bracing acidity provide balance. Enjoy through 2020.

title: Martín Berdugo 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Floral aromas mixed with citrus notes are appealing. This wine feels round but solidified by bright core acidity. Ripe flavors include pineapple, mango and peach. On the finish, lime and tropical notes are good but short.

title: McCall 2014 Reserve North Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Spice, vanilla and oak abound in this barrel-aged Chardonnay, but it's a neatly balanced wine with crisp-tart apple and pear flavors. Brisk acidity off sets a palate that's rich and substantial in texture.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2013 Reserve Red (Temecula Valley)
description: There are very ripe aromas of kirsch, cassis, licorice and root beer on the nose of this bottling, which begin to evolve into prunes, dried figs and raisins with time. The cola spice flavor is strong as are the prune and milk chocolate, all of which ride a strong tannic frame.

title: Glenora 2016 Bubbly Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: This delicately carbonated Riesling sparkler offers all of the grape's characteristic aromatic exuberance. It's blossomy and plump in notes of sweet peach, apple and lemon, yet bristling and spry. An easy going, light-bodied sip for everyday enjoyment.

title: Glenora 2016 Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Whiffs of smoky crushed slate lend some mineral depth to this light-bodied, medium-sweet Riesling. It's a deftly balanced wine offering zippy tangerine, lemon and lime tinged by a reverberating streak of honey.

title: Domaine Guillemot-Michel 2015 Quintaine  (Viré-Clessé)
description: This ripe, full-bodied wine is made from biodynamically grown grapes. Although rich, it has enough acidity to keeps it crisp and fruity. The wine is balanced and delicious, ready to drink now.

title: Domaine Jessiaume 2015  Auxey-Duresses
description: Behind the main vineyards of the Côte de Beaune, this village makes some delicious wines, both red and white. This village wine, full of fruit, also has wood-aging flavors and firm spicy tannins. It is coming together well and will be ready to drink from 2020.

title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2016 Vers Cras  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: This wine is tight and flinty. Crisp lemon and apple flavors are textured with a steely character that needs time to broaden out. Drink this mineral wine from 2019.

title: Domaine Perraud 2015  Saint-Véran
description: A mineral-driven wine, this is tangy-zesty, with a tight texture. Great fruit shines through the crispness. Balanced, ripe and with some potential, the wine will be ready from late 2018.

title: Finca Constancia 2014 Selección Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Floral berry aromas are drowned out by heavy scents of licorice and clove. A jumpy, fresh palate is raw but high in energy. Herbal, minty currant flavors are dry, oaky and toasty on the finish. This blend is made from six grapes, Syrah and Cab Sauvignon among them.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Hawkins Cellars 2014 Mourvèdre (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This blend of Horse Heaven Hills and Red Mountain fruit delivers brooding cherry and herb aromas and full-bodied black cherry flavors. The tannins contribute grit.

title: Hawley 2016 Viognier (Sonoma County)
description: Honeysuckle, lemongrass and wheat ride a robust wave of ripeness and bold texture in this white wine, which is exuberant in bright lemon-laced acidity.
